name: strov2rcl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5

stmt.origin: simpld(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c5, universe))
stmt.pretty: simpld(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ 𝕌, c5 ∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c5, universe)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c5, universe)))

stmt.origin: elbasov(c0, c1, c2, c5, c4, c3)
stmt.pretty: elbasov(c0, c1, c2, c5, c4, c3)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c5, universe)))
-| wrel(cdm(c4))
-| wceq(c3, co(c2, c4, c5))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe))
-| wrel(cdm(c4))
-| wceq(c3, co(c2, c4, c5))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))

comment: Partial reverse closure for any structure defined as a two-argument function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Mar-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 2-Dec-2019.)
